contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2010}} {{Infobox coat of arms |name = Coat of Arms of Canberra |image = Canberra COA.gif |image_width = |armiger = City of Canberra |year_adopted = 1928 |crest = Imperial Crown and portcullis, in front of a gum tree |torse = Argent (silver) and Azure (blue) |shield = White Rose, Castle, Sword, Mace and Imperial Crown |supporters = A Black Swan and a White Swan |compartment = Grassy Land |motto = '''For the Queen, the Law and the People''' |orders = |other_elements = |earlier_versions = |use = }} The '''coat of arms of Canberra''' was created by the Commonwealth Department of Home Affairs and Territories in 1927, in response to a request by the Commonwealth Department of Defence,<ref name="nla">[http://nla.gov.au/nla.cs-pa-http%253A%252F%252Fwww.basis.act.gov.au%252FDUSLibrary%252FImagesACT.nsf%252F3506a89b45287c52ca256abc000c49a8%252F3736769288053aaf4a256ca70016fe05!OpenDocument The Coat of Arms of the City of Canberra]. ''National Library of Australia: Picture Australia''. Accessed 1 July 2009.</ref> who wanted to use it on the newly commissioned ''[[HMAS Canberra (D33)|HMAS Canberra]]''.<ref name="nla" /> The [[Federal Capital Commission]] (FCC) announced a competition to design a [[coat of arms]] for both the ACT and the FCC.<ref name="nla" /> In April 1928, the design of one Mr C. R. Wylie, having won the competition, was sent to the [[College of Arms]], in London, for approval.<ref name="nla" /> The coat of arms at this stage did not include a motto. After minor adjustments, King George V granted the design by Royal Warrant dated 8 October 1928. The College of Arms issued the official exemplification (artistic rendition) and blazon (description) on 7 November 1928, along with a [[Crest (heraldry)|crest]].<ref name="nla" /> ==Symbolism== The various symbols of the coat of arms are explained below: *The ''crown'' symbolises [[Queen of Australia|Royal]] authority; *The ''mace'' symbolises the [[Parliament of Australia]]; *The ''sword'' symbolises the [[Sword of State]]; *The ''castle'' has three towers, symbolise the three branches of government (executive, legislature and judiciary); *The ''White Rose'' is the badge of the [[Duke of York]] who opened the old [[Parliament of Australia]] building in 1927, and who would later be crowned as [[King George VI of the United Kingdom]]. *The crowned ''[[portcullis]]'' again symbolises the parliament, this being the traditional symbol of the [[Palace of Westminster]] (which houses the [[Parliament of the United Kingdom]]); *Behind the portcullis is a Gum tree which symbolises Canberra's nickname "The Bush Capital"; *The supporters are the Australian [[black swan]], representing the [[Australian Aborigine]]s, and the European white [[swan]], representing the white settlers. *The motto is "For the Queen, the Law and the People" which is the English translation of "Pro Rege, Lege et Grege".<ref>http://www.archives.act.gov.au/home/educational_resource/find_of_the_month/2008/november_2008/previous_find_of_the_month</ref> ==References== {{ref-list}} * [http://www.cmd.act.gov.au/communication/flags ACT Chief Minister's Department] (same text) * [http://www.archives.act.gov.au/home/educational_resource/find_of_the_month/2008/november_2008/previous_find_of_the_month Archives of ACT] {{Australian coat of arms}} [[Category:Australian coats of arms|Canberra]] [[Category:Australian Capital Territory]]
